skillTree.localised_description: A Knightly formation, in the Lady's name, to smash through battle lines; to defeat evil in the field.
From the verdant depths, the Lady rises to protect the faithful.
Like the lion, this one is the biggest and the bravest of his kind... with the sharpest teeth.
One doesn't reach the rank of General without having survived many a battle.

effects.description: Casualty replenishment rate: +20% for this Lord

skillTree.localised_description: Courage, duty, honour – all meaningless without discipline. This commander demands their troops be perfectly drilled, that they may stand fast against even the darkest of the Empire's foes.
Having friends in the high places of Imperial society has its benefits. It's always *who* you know...
This one is loved and respected by their troops, many of whom have come from all over the world to fight at their side.
This Lord belts out orders and can be heard even across a battlefield smothered in the grim noise of war.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Don’t let Augustine’s shorter stature fool you. Underneath all that finery lies all the destructive impulse of a chariot.
“Everything you own is mine!”

effects.description:
Peasant's Duty commandment: additional -1 to control
	(all provinces)

Peasant's Duty commandment: additional 3% income
	(all provinces)

Peasant's Duty commandment: additional -2 to control
	(all provinces)

Peasant's Duty commandment: additional 6% income
	(all provinces)

Peasant's Duty commandment: additional -3 to control
	(all provinces)

Peasant's Duty commandment: additional 9% income
	(all provinces)

skillTree.localised_description: Augustine’s ambitions know no bounds: He envisions himself a worthy king.

“Never before has such heresy been committed on the fair lands of Bretonnia,” other nobles would whisper behind Augustine’s back, but he remains content in the knowledge that he is far more forward-thinking than his obstinate neighbours.
Adorning himself with petty baubles has inadvertently bestowed Augustine with a safety net against wizardry.
Thorough drilling increases the peasants' chances of withstanding the horrors of battle.
A drawn blade should not be put away until slaked in blood.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
"The enemy's fear; their blood spilt in the mud – these are the things that sustain me."
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
You don't want to be on the receiving end of this one’s attacks. You really don’t.
"Yes, they’re from the east. Annoying, yet useful - their hides, particularly…"
What Augustine wants, Augustine gets. The means are irrelevant.
What use armour, or even magical defences, against such powerful ordnance?
“Find something to hide behind and fire back at the bastards!”
A clever arrangement of lenses makes the target seem just that bit closer.
There are those who have a knack for pushing artillery and their crews to new heights, allowing such machines to fire further than ever before.
Some leaders radiate such power that inspires their followers to commit foulest acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +120
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Even stupid peasants can learn to stand fast and brace against the charge.

skillTree.localised_description: When the alternative probably involves being killed by their own side, the smallfolk tend to rise to the occasion...

skillTree.localised_description: Many Bretonnian veterans speak of a soothing presence felt on occasion in the heat of battle, helping them to find their mark and keep their cool.

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
As an expert in such matters, it is their duty to know the king's law and to mete justice in his name.
The Lords rule, the peasants toil. Nothing has changed in over a thousand years.
The Lord is entitled to collect tithes from tenants in return for continued protection.
They've seen the Lady's acts or witnessed her blessed grace.
Those whom the Lady has blessed fight with an unquenchable, almost super-human zeal, for they know that she sees them.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for this Lord
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: "The land from here to the sea is yours, if you enforce the king's will."
The knowledge that they fight in the king's name, with his support, steels an army for the privations of the siege.
This being must be touched by Tzeentch, seeing things before they happen.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +8%
Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +15%

skillTree.localised_description: Lords must not be concerned with the collecting of taxes; there are others whose lot it is to feel the people's scorn.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
Witnessing friendly units with the Peasant Attribute rout will not affect this unit's leadership.

factionEffects.localised_description: Over many battles and countless acts of treachery, Viscount Augustine de Chegney has proven himself a master of guile.

effects.description:
Gain following for 3 turns after declaring war:
	  Hero Action Success Chance: +20% (all armies)
	  Opportunistic Murderer (all characters)
	  Sacking Settlments: +50%
	  Enemy reinforcement time: +50%
Peasant Economy: +5 peasants available to the faction

Upkeep: +25% for Grail Knights, Grail Guardians, Royal Pegasus Knights, Royal Hippogryph Knights
	(all armies)
Hornered Rat:  Melee Attack: +8  &  Leadership: +6 to Augustine army after retreating

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Viscount Augustine is considered an unorthodox and dishonourable man by his fellow Knights for the overtness of his cruelty towards the peasantry and, more importantly, his use of a blackpowder pistol.
